reviews.sentence: 6 days. Staff is helping. This place grows slowly on you but believe me its kind of hidden jewel near downtown very convenient location close by stop to go santa Monica or venice. Metro stop and shopping mall on walking distance next door 7 11 convenient store. Loads of renovation is going on. For the price its good place to stay.

It was okay. A lot of the things I have come to expect in a hotel hair dryer towel rack etc were not available in my room. The room was quite small compared to other hotel rooms but it was comfortable enough. There were a lot of construction and renovation inside the hotel so hopefully this means a better Mayfair Hotel in the future.

The Historic Mayfair is a mixed bag. Anyone reading reviews knows the Mayfair is under renovation. The result is that things are erratic. My room was on the top floor and had been renovated it was a cute room and they let me check in early. All good. Except I did not have towels and when I turned down the bed the blanket had a LOT not just a few. long black hairs all over it and the second morning they did not actually va cum the carpet. They were cheerful about bringing towels and a clean blanket so it worked out but it was not great. On Sunday they left a note saying the water would be off all day Monday starting at 9. They gave me a price break on the room when I pointed out that if their renovations had a negative effect it should be absorbed by the owners who will eventually benefit rather than by the customers who will not. Overall it is a good location and a good price and the staff works extremely hard to be responsive but it is currently experiencing some growing pains and requires some patience and understanding.
Disappointing. No air conditioner Under renovation.
Renovation caused problems. The bed was large and the staff were lovely. It was a dirty building site. Unfortunately the extent of the renovations was not made clear before booking.

Never again. The internet was slow the renovations created noise not being able to dine or purchase anything at the hotel was an inconvenience was unable to workout while on trip has issues with staff coffee was not available on one particular morning. I would like to get part or all refunded.
Pleasant. Rooms newly decorated really nice. Very comfortable bed. No facilities at all downstairs as undergoing renovations.
Good. You never disclosed that the bar was under renovation. There was no central meeting point to meet friends and relax. Beds were comfortable and location excellent though.

Fair. The room was clean and staff were friendly. The location was n’t great and many of the facilities we anticipated using restaurant gym etc were all closed for renovations. The room was so very small.

Nice spartan but very comfortable. A local music venue half block away. Renovations were underway on a different floor and the restaurant was about to open. Neither were bothersome during the visit. Not having a restaurant in the morning during the time there.

This newly renovated historic hotel has many nice features for the money a good value. The neighborhood is in flux and keeping the rates low. Our room was nice and clean inside. The windows were not clean and looked like they had some spatter on them from construction. Some of the hardware and fittings in the room are not very high quality so it looks like they had a tight budget. There was no soap at the lavatory sink so we had to use the shower dispenser. Also no hand towels were provided so we had to ask for them. I had a drink at the bar. it was a slow night Saturday and up to 6 hotel staff congregated behind the bar talking about poor management and getting into disagreements with each other. This is not pleasant for the guests who can HEAR the conversation.
Historic hotel near downtown LA. Rooms renovated previously and relatively nice. Lobby just finished renovation and is gorgeous. Neighborhood is only so so.

Be careful. We were 2 couples and thought we had 2 rooms booked and confirmed online. We were told upon arrival we had no booking but they did have rooms available so we took them 4 nights my wife and I 3 nights for our other couple. Strangely our car park booking was acknowledged immediately when we delivered our rental car to the subterranean car park. Rooms are small and do not have a bar fridge but do have a safe. The rooms are ok. The hotel has recently had a US7 million refurbishment and is visually wonderful in black white and greys only. Its gym and other facilities are on the way. We were billed over AUS30 after we had returned home to Australia for no reason but had these pending Visa card transactions deleted after a bit of work online and by phone. Great location for downtown LA but watch everything.
Over priced updated rooms. Nice staff.

Incredible Hotel Highly recommend. The Mayfair Hotel is a gorgeous establishment with modern renovations. The rooms are clean and well serviced. The staff are incredibly helpful and always greet you. Tenia checked us in and out and went above and beyond to accommodate us impeccable customer service. Highly recommend staying at The Mayfair Hotel it is a fantastic place to stay whilst in Los Angeles and closely located to the 7th Street Station and Staples Center which was very convenient.

A Mixed Bag. Not familiar with downtown LA I booked this hotel because it appeared to be close to the hotel where my convention was held and at 12 the price. What I did n’t know is the area north of 110 is pretty seedy. Contrary to the advertising they do not offer a breakfast. The nearest place is a 10 minute walk through a homeless encampment. Needless to say you need to forgo walking and take Uber or Lyft for your safety when going to and from this property. My room was small like New York small and had a peculiar layout. There was no place to put luggage. The bed which was comfortable was accessible from just one side. The bathroom was nicely modernized always had hot water but was without a normal door. When I booked the hotel it listed a fitness room which is really important to me. There is no fitness room. I visited a nearby gym at a cost of 23 a day gym fee and Uber rides. I asked to be reimbursed for this cost and was denied. The lobby of the hotel turns into a lively party room at night so request a high floor if you are a light sleeper. On a positive note the restaurant and espresso shop were excellent and the staff was very friendly. While I did save a little money staying here the lack of a gym seedy area small rooms noise and lack of a breakfast will insure that I wo n’t stay here again.

I used to stay here quite a bit as a business travel. After the remodel it seems to cater to special events more than business travels. I will not be a regular anymore after staying here 30 times. Had a special event tonight that blocked of the entire restaurant playing rap in the lobby with F Bombs and was told there is a full menu tonight at the bar because the restaurant is closed only to be told a the bar after sitting there for 20 minutes that I can not order from the restaurant. Instead of making an exception and taking care of a regular they are focused on a big pay day from events.
It ’s a cool historic place that has been well updated.

My team and I just photographed The Mayfair ’s first wedding since all the renovations on January 11 2020. We have nothing but great things to say about this wedding venue. First off it is located in the heart of downtown LA. The skyline is easily visible from the terrace such a gorgeous view. There are endless photo opportunities both indoor and outdoor all over the property. Even inside the lighting was perfect due to large windows and skylights throughout. The hotel has a beautiful Old Hollywood Great Gatsby vibe that really came through in the photos. Not only was the venue stunning the staff and event team was so organized professional and timely. They made sure the bride and groom were well taken care of all night. At one point the bartender even brought them drinks while we were taking photos which was the perfect break and added an elegant touch to the images. Spencer event manager was so responsive leading up to the wedding and very easy to work with. During reception the catering captain showed my team to a private area during our break and fed us an amazing meal to make sure we were taken care of too. We love the Mayfair Hotel and ca n’t wait to photograph more weddings there in the future.

What an absolute pleasure it was to stay at The Mayfair Hotel. The property is completely remodeled without losing the integrity of the original architecture. The entire staff is truly amazing friendly and helpful. I highly recommend a visit here. It is also right next to the theater we were going to which was a huge bonus. Plenty of space to relax and unwind a beautiful full bar coffee shop and restaurant a cozy fireplace in the lobby. We definitely will be going back again. Thank you.
